oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1940s Beale Street
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Business Districts
Beale Street (Memphis, Tenn.); African American business enterprises; African Americans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of a busy street with marquees for a variety of businesses and recreational venues, 1940s model automobiles, and African Americans on the street and sidewalks.
Beale Street looking west. The New Daisy Theatre is visible at back right, as well as signs for bowling lanes, the Avalon Pool Room, and Wilson Drugs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Memphis and Shelby County Room, Memphis Public Library and Information Center
